Eight qualities of a mendicant worthy of: Restrained in the code of conduct
Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken
Learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned
Prevailing over desire and discontent, and living having mastered fear and dread whenever they arose
Getting the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty
Teachings that the mendicant is learned: These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end
Describing a spiritual practice that’s totally full and pure
They are very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reciting them, mentally scrutinizing them, and comprehending them theoretically
Qualities that the mendicant has realize: They realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life
They live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
